    My name is Linus Torvalds and I am your god.<br/>
    我的名字是Linus Torvalds，我是你们的上帝。（在1998 Linux大会上的自我介绍）
    
    If you still don’t like it, that’s OK: that’s why I’m boss. I simply know better than you do.<br/>
    如果你还是不喜欢Linux，没关系，这就是为什么我在当家的原因：因为我对技术的理解比你更深。
    
    “Regression testing”? What’s that? If it compiles, it is good; if it boots up, it is perfect.<br/>
    “回归测试”？这是什么东西？如果代码能编译就是好的，如果它启动了，那就是完美的。
    
    Talk is cheap. Show me the code.<br/>
    空谈是不值钱的。给我看你的代码就好。
    
    Those that can, do. Those that can’t, complain.<br/>
    有能力的人一直在干活，没能力的人一直在抱怨。
    
    Really, I’m not out to destroy Microsoft. That will just be a completely unintentional side effect.<br/>
    真的，我没打算要摧毁微软。这种结果将会是完全无意中产生的副作用。
    
    I’m always right. This time I’m just even more right than usual.<br/>
    我就是永远正确。这次我比平时还要更正确一些。
    
    Nobody actually creates perfect code the first time around, except me. But there’s only one of me.<br/>
    实际上没人能一次就写出完美的代码，除了我。但是世界上只有一个我。
    
    If you need more than 3 levels of indentation, you’re screwed anyway, and should fix your program.<br/>
    如果你的代码里需要有超过三层的缩进，那么你已经搞砸了，应该修改你的代码。
    
    Real quality means making sure that people are proud of the code they write, that they’re involved and taking it personally.<br/>
    真正的质量意味着让程序员为他们写的代码自豪，参与到编写代码之中并把它当做自己个人的事情。
    
    Standards are paper. I use paper to wipe my butt every day. That’s how much that paper is worth.<br/>
    标准就是纸张。我每天都用纸张擦屁股。这就是这些纸张的价值所在。
    
    I like offending people, because I think people who get offended should be offended.<br/>
    我喜欢埋汰人，因为我觉得那些被埋汰的人活该被埋汰。
    
    Portability is for people who cannot write new programs.<br/>
    “可移植性”的概念是为那些不会写新程序的人准备的。
